meta.confidenceScale: High (vendor official / regulatory filing), Medium (third-party verified), Low (marketing claim / forum post)

ai_document_intelligence.source: Microsoft Learn - Azure AI Document Intelligence Pricing
ai_document_intelligence.notes: Official Microsoft pricing. Read is cheapest for OCR; Prebuilt for standard document types; Custom for domain-specific. We use Read for leases + LLM extraction (cheaper than Custom extraction).

ai_search_cognitive_search.billing_model: Flat hourly rate per unit; 730 hours/month assumed
ai_search_cognitive_search.notes: Third-party verified rates. Official Azure page does not display static prices on-page (dynamic pricing). S1 suitable for 1,000-site baseline; can scale to S2/S3 if needed.

blob_storage_hot_tier.source_uk: Synextra - Azure Blob Storage Pricing Guide 2025
blob_storage_hot_tier.source_us: N2WS Backup & Recovery - Azure Storage Pricing 2025
blob_storage_hot_tier.notes: UK pricing from Synextra (UK-specific data). US pricing from N2WS (common US reference). Hot tier used for active data; Cool tier available for archive at ~60% discount.
blob_storage_hot_tier.regional_variance: UK rates slightly lower than US due to regional pricing; always verify with live Azure Retail Prices API.

gpt_4o_mini.source: Reuters - OpenAI Unveils Cheaper Small AI Model GPT-4o Mini (2024-07-18)
gpt_4o_mini.notes: Lowest-cost OpenAI model with high performance for extraction. Typical input:output ratio for extraction ~10:1 (input tokens for prompt + document, output for extracted fields). Assume ~10% of input tokens as output.
gpt_4o_mini.example_cost_1000_sites: 101.25M input tokens × £0.123 = £12.45; ~10.1M output × £0.492 = £4.97; TOTAL ≈ £17.42 for extraction

gpt_4_turbo.notes: Higher-cost model for sensitivity testing. 20× more expensive than 4o-mini; used as upper-bound scenario only.

sources.name: GrowthFactor - AI-Powered Lease Abstraction ROI
sources.excerpt: Manual lease abstraction typically costs $100-$4,000 per lease depending on complexity and vendor.

sources.name: LeaseLens - What is Lease Abstraction?
sources.excerpt: Manual services quote 'hundreds of dollars per lease' for 4-8 hours of professional time.

sources.name: Kolena - ROI of AI Powered Lease Abstraction in CRE
sources.excerpt: Manual abstraction labor: ~£30/hour (US admin) × 4-8 hours = $120-$240 per lease baseline.

manual_abstraction_services.notes: Range reflects complexity (simple standard leases at low end; complex leases with multiple amendments at high end). Baseline for 1,000-site comparison assumes mid-point for 'typical' leases.

ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.scope: Free preview; pay to export extracted data
ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.fields_claimed: Varies by document; no specific count published
ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.notes: Lowest cost per-lease SaaS option. Export-based pricing; full solution cost depends on volume and SLA.
ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.what_not_included: SSO/MFA, audit logs, governed APIs, Digital Twin integration, ingestion automation from ERPs

ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.scope: Advertised as 180+ fields; includes clause extraction
ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.notes: Mid-tier per-lease vendor. Marketing claims 180+ fields; requires verification against Cornerstone Appendix-1 scope.
ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.what_not_included: SSO/MFA, audit logs, governed APIs, Digital Twin integration, multi-tenant deployment, ingestion automation

ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.scope: Limited feature set; not comparable to full platform
ai_saas_per_lease_pricing.notes: Advertised extremely low tier; likely limited features, not a like-for-like comparator. Used only for sensitivity lower-bound.

uk_contractor_day_rates.source: IT Jobs Watch - UK Contract Job Trends
uk_contractor_day_rates.notes: Represents current UK contract market rates. Our blended rates align well with these benchmarks, validating our hybrid model (60% internal, 40% contractor).
uk_contractor_day_rates.interpretation: Our blended rates (60% internal staff, 40% contractor) land in the 25th-50th percentile—conservative but market-conformant. This validates our cost model against external market benchmarks.

cornerstone_ai_model_baseline.notes: Baseline calculation with Likely case assumptions (50/35/15 quality mix, 20 min review). Machine costs (OCR + LLM) = £184 (~0.14% of total cost). Build engineering and manual review are the cost drivers.

ocr_read_model.backing: Microsoft Learn official pricing; cheapest option for legible documents. Prebuilt (£8.20/1k) and Custom (£41/1k) are 6–33× more expensive; only justified for highly specialized forms.
ocr_read_model.sensitivity: If switched to Custom extraction: ≈ £5,535 instead of £166 (33× increase); still <1% of total cost.

llm_model.backing: Reuters 2024-07-18 + OpenAI official. 4o-mini is purpose-built for high-volume, low-latency extraction. Assumes 750 tokens/page × 1 pipeline pass × 101.25M tokens = £12.15.
llm_model.sensitivity: If switched to GPT-4 Turbo (20× cost): ≈ £242 instead of £12. Still <0.2% of total. Machine costs are not the constraint.

manual_review_rate.backing: ITJobsWatch data shows UK contractor QA roles at £350–500/day; £44/hr ≈ £350/day. We bill 10% of flagged hours; client does 90% internally.
manual_review_rate.sensitivity: If raised to £75/hr (premium London rate): £5,500 → £8,250 (+50%); still only 6% of ingestion. Not a primary cost driver.

build_engineering.backing: Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) cross-referenced to Cornerstone scope: ingestion orchestration (27 days) + cross-doc reasoning (38 days) + security/compliance (24 days) + DevOps (18 days) + QA testing (20 days) + PM (30 days) = 157 days core, + overheads/design/integration = 230 days.
build_engineering.resource_mix: 7 roles (SA, ML, BE, FE, DevOps, QA, PM) with blended rates (60% internal £300–£630/day, 40% contractor £350–£650/day).
build_engineering.cost: £100,000 @ blended rates; £191,500 priced (100% markup = typical for hybrid vendor model).
build_engineering.justification: Necessary to deliver: Siterra bulk/delta ingestion, cross-document linker, SSO/MFA, 12-month audit logs, DPIA/SSAQ, pen-test, UAT coordination, low-touch support setup.

azure_search_s1.backing: TrustRadius: S1 @ $0.336/hr × 730 hrs = $245/mo ≈ £200. Suitable for 1,000 sites; can upgrade to S2/S3 if search volume exceeds S1 capacity.
azure_search_s1.scaling: S2 = £1,003/mo (5× cost). S1 is entry-level; we start here, client can request upgrade if needed.

app_hosting.backing: Typical Azure App Service (B2 or P1V2) for low-to-medium traffic (ingestion is async, Q&A is on-demand). Does not include CI/CD, backups, or incident response (covered in PM/support).
app_hosting.scaling: Scales with replica count; baseline assumes 1–2 instances.

monitoring_logging.backing: Log Analytics workspace + dashboards + alerts. Baseline storage ~1–2 GB/month for 1,000 sites (12-month retention = policy requirement).
monitoring_logging.scaling: Logs grow ~1 GB/month; storage cost minimal; main cost is ingestion/analysis at that scale.

support_hours.backing: Low-touch model: client owns data validation, we provide exceptions/guidance. 16 hrs = ~0.5 FTE analyst + PM overhead for escalations and planning.

why_below_target: 1. Benchmark rates: Our hybrid model (60% internal, 40% contractor) uses market-aligned day rates. Room to optimize: use more internal staff (lower rates) or reduce build scope.
2. Amortization assumption: Build cost spread over 5,000 sites (aspirational). Actual deployment at 1,000 sites → higher per-site build cost. Fix: increase booking/commitment or raise base price.
3. Manual review floor: At 20 min/doc × 13% review fraction = 325 review hours. Only billing 10% = £5,500. Raising to 15% billed → +£825 (~+0.7% margin).
4. Support model: Baseline support (16 hrs/mo) may be too generous. Premium tiers cost more; client can opt up if they want more.

levers_to_improve_margin.lever: Switch to Conservative scenario (+50% labor, +10% PT)
levers_to_improve_margin.probability: High (but lower price may lose deals)
